messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] RE: Screen readers plus OT question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Matt, No problem, me, I m at the other end of the age thing, well 49, almost blind, and have been teaching sword play for nigh on 23 years, which I got in
messages.messageBody:
Hi Matt,

No problem, me, I'm at the other end of the age thing, well 49, almost
blind, and have been teaching sword play for nigh on 23 years, which I
got in to by mistake and have never regretted it:-) My other half Mary
is also disabled, with a spinal injury, but she's dam good with a sword,
never should have taught her everything I know....

Good luck with your life plans, and remember to make a difference, and
then just enjoy the ride!

Yours

Dean
***

messages.subject: RE: Screen readers plus OT question
messages.msgSnippet: Dean, Sorry about the Mr. thing, force of habit.  :-) My life plan to is to work with museums to help them adapt their exhibits to the blind.  I am currently
messages.messageBody:
Dean,

Sorry about the "Mr." thing, force of habit. :-)
My life plan to is to work with museums to help them adapt their exhibits
to the blind. I am currently in grad school working for my Masters in
Public History (museum methodology and such). My secondary goal is to start
teaching martial arts to the disabled. Other than that, I am just a normal
23 year old kid. :-)


Peace,

Matt

_________________________________________________________________

messages.subject: Screen readers plus OT question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Matt, Cheers for the supportive noises:-) Not having any joy yet, but hay ho, these things have a way of working themselves out in the end, especially if
messages.messageBody:
Hi Matt,

Cheers for the supportive noises:-) Not having any joy yet, but hay ho,
these things have a way of working themselves out in the end, especially
if one kicks hard enough!

Anyway, two things:

1, to my friends and to those who have not yet found themselves
classified as my enemies, I am "Dean", I leave "Mr Wayland" to either my
afore mentioned "enemies", who are few:-) And to those dreadfully formal
communications with folks that I am not yet on personal terms with, in
Japan, and....

2. Come on Matt, you can't leave us all dangling upon a narrative hook,
so what did you decide to do with your life? No need to panic, voluntary
rambling answers only required:-)

Yours

Dean
(man banging computer with rock)

****

messages.subject: Re: Screen readers
messages.msgSnippet: Mr. Wayland, I wish I had some suggestions.  Unfortunatly the only experience I have with JAWS is from my ex-girlfriend.  She is totally blind and could use
messages.messageBody:
Mr. Wayland,

I wish I had some suggestions. Unfortunatly the only experience I have
with JAWS is from my ex-girlfriend. She is totally blind and could use that
computer better than most seasoned pros. Of course the mouse was never used
so I leared a LOT of keyboard commands just by watching her. It was my
relationship with her that helped me to decide what I want to do with my
life.
Anyhow, enough rambling. Best of luck with getting your upgrades.


Peace,

Matt

_________________________________________________________________
Get ready for school! Find articles, homework help and more in the Back to
School Guide! http://special.msn.com/network/04backtoschool.armx

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Screen readers
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Matt, Yes that s the puppy, I use JAWS 4.5 Pro to read out the screen, along with Zoomtext 7.1 Level 1 (Magnification only) to split the screen, with the
messages.messageBody:
Hi Matt,

Yes that's the puppy, I use JAWS 4.5 Pro to "read out" the screen, along
with Zoomtext 7.1 Level 1 (Magnification only) to split the screen, with
the bottom half at x16 on a 19" monitor.

I'm in a little dispute with my supplier at the moment, who I believe I
had an upgrade contract with, which they seem to have lost all record
of, trouble is I can't find my paper work:-(.

I'm trying to acquire version 5.0 of JAWS and the 8.1 version of
Zoomtext, which I hope will go some way to solving the problems, well
maybe:-)

Anyway, any suggestions?

Yours

Dean

***
